nextSteps.title: Here's what happens next:
steps: You will get this confirmation code emailed to you.
You need to go to your local DMV office to finalize your application.
Prepare for your visit by collecting the required documents and studying for your knowledge test(s). We’ve created a custom preparation list based on the information you provided in your application.
At the DMV field office, show the employee your confirmation number and documents. They will bring up your application.
You will be asked to verify your information. You will then certify that it's correct during your DMV field office visit.

confirmationPage.registrationCompleteAtOffice: As a reminder, your voter registration application will be processed when you complete your application at the DMV field office.
confirmationPage.registerSooner: If you need to register to vote before your DMV visit: You can register online at RegisterToVote.ca.gov.
confirmationPage.register30days: If you would like to vote in the next statewide election register online now at RegisterToVote.ca.gov.
confirmationPage.avoidLines: To avoid long waits and lines, make an appointment at your local DMV now.

confirmationCDL.commercialLearnersPermit: Should you pass your knowledge tests and fulfill all other requirements, you will be issued a Commercial Learner's Permit (CLP). There is a mandatory waiting period of 14 days between when your CLP is issued and when you will become eligible to receive a temporary Commercial Driver License.

medical.title: Medical information
medical.body: The following conditions that may affect your ability to operate a motor vehicle safely include, but are not limited to: loss of consciousness; episode of marked confusion caused by any condition which may bring about recurring lapses; disease, disorder, or disability (examples of these are epilepsy, diabetes, stroke, cataracts, Parkinson’s disease); decrease or change in your vision due to cataracts, macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy, glaucoma, retinitis pigmentosa, or other progressive condition; health problems because of alcohol or drug abuse.

veteran.title: Veteran statement
veteran.body: By marking the veteran box on this application, I certify that I am a veteran of the United States Armed Forces and that I want to receive veteran benefits information from the California Department of Veterans A airs (CalVet). By marking the veteran box on this application, I also consent to DMV transmitting my name and mailing address to CalVet for this purpose only, and I certify that I have been notified that this transmittal will occur.

organDonation.title: Organ donation statement
organDonation.body: If you marked ‘Yes’ to register as an organ and tissue donor, you are legally authorizing the recovery of organs and tissues in the event of your death. Registering as a donor will not a ect your medical treatment in any way. As outlined in the California Anatomical Gift Act, your authorization is legally binding and, unless the donor is under 18 years of age, your decision does not require the consent of any other person. For registered donors under 18 years of age, the legal guardian shall make the  nal donation decision. You may limit your donation to speci c organs or tissues, place usage restrictions (for example transplantation or research), obtain more information about donation, or remove your name from the registry on the website of Donate Life California: www.donateLIFEcalifornia.org. By registering as an Organ Donor, you are giving your consent to allow DMV to electronically transmit your true full name, residence or mailing address, year of birth, and California driver license or identi cation card number to Donate Life California. By signing this form, you consent to this process and have been notified that this transmittal will occur.

voterRegistration.title: Voter registration
bodyBullets: If sharing your address could put you in life-threatening danger, you may be eligible to register to vote confidentially. For more information, contact the Safe at Home program at (877) 322-5227 or visit www.sos.ca.gov/safeathome/.

For U.S. citizens only. If you indicate that you are eligible to vote, the DMV will send all of the voter registration information collected on this form, including your digital signature, to the Secretary of State. The o ce where you registered will remain con dential and will be used only for voter registration purposes.

If you are eligible to vote and decline to register to vote, your decision will remain con dential; however this information will be sent to the Secretary of State to be used only for voter outreach and registration purposes.
Voter registration information provided on this application is con dential. The DMV does not make voter eligibility determinations.
If you have not received voter registration information within 30 days of registering, contact your county elections o cial or the Secretary of State.
Please visit voterstatus.sos.ca.gov/ for more information about your voter registration or www.sos.ca.gov for general information.

criminalProsecution.title: Criminal prosecution
bodyBullets: If you submit fraudulent information, the DMV may pursue criminal prosecution.
Any person who uses false documents to conceal their true citizenship or resident alien status is guilty of a felony pursuant to California Penal Code §114.

financialResponsibility.title: Financial responsibility
bodyBullets: Financial responsibility (commonly known as insurance) is required on all vehicles operated or parked on California roadways. You must carry evidence of financial responsibility in your vehicle at all times and it must be provided when: requested by law enforcement, renewing vehicle registration, the vehicle is involved in a traffic collision.

If you cannot afford liability insurance, you may be eligible for the California Low Cost Automobile Insurance Program. Additional information is available at www.mylowcostauto.com or by calling (866) 602-8861.

paymentRefunds.title: Payments / Refunds
bodyBullets: Visit www.dmv.ca.gov to review payment options at your local DMV field office. If you are mailing your renewal, payment must be by check. (Checks should be payable to DMV).
Once this application form and fee have been submitted, no refunds will be made.

privacy.title: Privacy notice
bodyBullets: DMV uses the information on this form to determine your eligibility for a Driver License or Identification Card and for the administration of driver license laws.

Information provided to DMV on this form is collected and subject to the limitations in the Information Practices Act (Civil Code 1798 et seq.), the Driver’s Privacy Protection Act (18 U.S.C. 2721-2725), the California Vehicle Code (CVC) and other applicable state and federal laws and regulations.
DMV verifies the information and documents you provide with other governmental agencies.

All information on this form is mandatory except where noted. DMV may deny your application for not providing the required information. Failure to provide the information required on this form is cause for refusal to issue a driver license or identi cation card, or, in some cases, cancellation or withdrawal of the driving privilege.

DMV shares your information with other governmental agencies, law enforcement, and commercial entities as authorized by law. You may obtain a copy of your record at www.dmv.ca.gov or at any DMV field office during regular office hours. For assistance with access to your record, call (800) 777-0133 or make an appointment to visit a DMV field office during regular business hours. For assistance with corrections to your record, contact DMV’s Licensing Operations Division Mandatory Actions Unit at (916) 657-6525.
Questions regarding your Driver License or Identification Card should be addressed to: Driver License Inquiries, Department of Motor Vehicles, PO Box 942890, Sacramento, CA 94290-0001.

For more information regarding specific CVC Sections or how DMV shares your information, please visit www.dmv.ca.gov. You may also request a copy of How Your DMV Information is Shared (FFDMV 17) Fast Facts brochure from any field office.
DMV’s Privacy Policy is located at www.dmv.ca.gov under the 'Privacy Policy' link at the bottom of the page.
Questions regarding this notice should be addressed to: Department of Motor Vehicles, ATTN: Chief Privacy Officer – MS F127, PO Box 932328, Sacramento, CA 94232-3280.

certifications.title: Certifications
bodyBullets: I agree to submit to a chemical test of my blood, breath, or urine for the purpose of determining the alcohol or drug content of my blood when testing is requested by a peace o cer acting in accordance with California Vehicle Code (CVC) §23612.

I am hereby advised that being under the in uence of alcohol or drugs, or both, impairs the ability to safely operate a motor vehicle. Therefore, it is extremely dangerous to human life to drive while under the in uence of alcohol or drugs, or both. If I drive while under the in uence of alcohol or drugs, or both, and as a result, a person is killed, I can be charged with murder.

By signing this application, I certify that I was notified that if I am under 21 years of age, I cannot legally drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of 0.01% or more. Driving with a BAC of 0.01% or more, or refusing to take, or failing to complete an alcohol screening or drug test, results in a one-year suspension of my driving privilege.

By signing this application, I certify that I was notified that if I am currently on court probation for a driving under the in uence o ense, I cannot legally drive with a BAC of 0.01% or more. Driving with a BAC of 0.01% or more results in a one-year suspension of my driving privilege. Refusing to take, or failing to complete an alcohol screening or chemical test will result in a two to three year suspension/revocation of my driving privilege.

I am the person whose name appears on the front of this form. The mailing address shown is valid, existing, and accurate. I agree to accept service of process at this mailing address according to §§415.20(b), 415.30(a), and 416.90 of the California Code of Civil Procedure.
I understand DMV may add traffic convictions reported by other states or jurisdictions to my driving record that may result in sanctions against my California driving privilege.
By signing this form, I am acknowledging my presence in the United States is authorized under federal law, except as speci ed in CVC §12801.
I understand I may have no more than one driver license in my possession or under my control in accordance with CVC §12511.
By signing this application, I certify that I understand traffic signs and signals in accordance with CVC §12800(h).

switchLanguagePage.prompt: Please select a language to use for this application.

namePage.explanation: This is the name that appears on official identity documents like your birth certificate and passport.

wdywtdtPage.prompt: What would you like to do today?
wdywtdtPage.explanation: Pick one option for now. You can add another option later in the application.
values: Get a card for the first time

prompt.id: Do you plan on using your ID to fly?
prompt.license: Do you plan on using your Driver License to fly?
prompt.card: Do you plan on using your card to fly?

realIdPage.explanation: As of October 1, 2020, you will need a REAL ID compliant driver license or ID card to fly within the United States.

FAQ-whatIsRealID.title: What's a REAL ID compliant card?
FAQ-whatIsRealID.body:
To meet the REAL ID Act, the California DMV will offer two types of cards: a REAL ID compliant card and a federal non-compliant card. Both a REAL ID compliant and a federal non-compliant driver license allow you to legally drive. 

 You need a REAL ID compliant card in order to fly within the U.S or to enter military bases and most federal facilities starting October 1, 2020. 

 Otherwise, you will need a passport or other document accepted by the Transportation Security Administration and the Department of Homeland Security.

FAQ-whatRequiredForRealID.title: What's required to get a REAL ID compliant card?

body.header: You will need 1 of the following:
items: Valid, unexpired U.S. passport or passport card
U.S. Certificate or Consular Report of Birth Abroad
Unexpired foreign passport with valid U.S. visa and approved I-94 form
Certified copy of Birth certificate from a U.S. Territory
Unexpired employment authorization document (EAD) Card (I-766) or valid/expired EAD Card with Notice of Action (I-797 C)
body.otherRequirements: You also need one document that proves you live in California and one document with your Social Security Number such as your Social Security card or Internal Revenue Service form (e.g., W2, 1099, or 1040).

prompt.renew: What type of card are you renewing?
prompt.replace: What type of card are you replacing?
prompt.correctOrUpdate: What type of card are you correcting or updating?

seniorIdPage.prompt: Would you like to get a free Senior Identification Card
seniorIdPage.explanation: If you do not want "Senior Identification Card", you will have to pay the normal fee.

reducedFeePage.prompt: Are you applying for a reduced fee or free ID?
reducedFeePage.licenseExplanation: This only applies to your ID Card. You cannot get a free or reduced fee driver license.

rightFormsSection.prompt: Do you have the right form?
rightFormsSection.explanation: In order to get a reduced fee ID you need to have the Reduced Fee Identification Card Eligibility Verification form (DL 937). To get a free ID you need to have No Fee Identification Card Eligibility Verification (DL 933) form.

FAQ-howToGetForms.title: How do I get these forms?
FAQ-howToGetForms.body: The DMV does not provide these forms. If you get assistance through the government or a non-profit, speak with them about getting a form.

licenseTypePage.prompt: What do you need to drive?

values.label: Housecar, 5th wheel over 15000 pounds, or livestock trailer

endorsementsSection.prompt: Do you need a firefighter endorsement?
endorsementsSection.explanation: If you only want an ambulance certificate, please visit a DMV field office.

whatYouAreDoing.realIDCompliantID: Your ID card will be REAL ID Compliant.
whatYouAreDoing.realIDCompliantLicense: Your driver license will be REAL ID Compliant.

update.license: In order to update your driver license, you’re going to need to fill out a new application.
update.id: In order to update your ID card, you’re going to need to fill out a new application.

correct.license: In order to correct your driver license, you’re going to need to fill out a new application.
correct.id: In order to correct your ID card, you’re going to need to fill out a new application.

replace.license: In order to replace your driver license, you’re going to need to fill out a new application.
replace.id: In order to replace your ID card, you’re going to need to fill out a new application.

getStartedPage.timeToComplete: It takes around 10 minutes to complete.
getStartedPage.afterComplete: Once you’re done, you will need to visit your local DMV office.

currentCardPage.prompt: If you know it, please enter your California DL/ID card number.
currentCardPage.explanation: Your number can be found at the top of your DL/ID card starting with a letter.

correctOrUpdatePage.prompt: What would you like to do?

prompt.update: What would you like to update?
prompt.correct: What would you like to correct?

license.explanation: You may need to pay a fee for a new Driver License with these updates.

id.explanation: You may need to pay a fee for a new ID with these updates.

replacementReasonPage.prompt: Why do you need to replace your card?
replacementReasonPage.explanation: Your answer will help DMV employees better assist you.

youthDlNotificationPage.prompt: You must be 15.5 years old to get a learners permit.
youthDlNotificationPage.explanation: If you go to a DMV office sooner to complete your application, you can only apply for a Junior permit. These permits are issued only in exceptional circumstances.
youthDlNotificationPage.question: Would you like to get a California ID card instead?

cantApplyYet.prompt: Because you’re under 15 years old, you can’t apply for a driver license. Would you like to get a California ID card instead?
cantApplyYet.infoMessage: OK, please come back when you turn 14 years old.

addressesPage.explanation: Example: 1234 Main St., Los Angeles, CA 90017
addressesPage.mailingAddressSamePrompt: Do you get mail at this address?

mailingAddressSameExplanation.license: The DMV will print your mailing address on your Driver License. Your Driver License will also be sent to your mailing address.
mailingAddressSameExplanation.ID: The DMV will print your mailing address on your ID. Your ID will also be sent to your mailing address.
mailingAddressSameExplanation.cards: The DMV will print your mailing address on your cards. Your cards will also be sent to your mailing address.

addressesPage.mailingAddressExplanation: Example: PO Box 901, Los Angeles, CA 90017

socialSecurityPage.prompt: Do you have a Social Security Number?
socialSecurityPage.explanation: If you have a Social Security Number you must select Yes.
socialSecurityPage.messageNo: By answering No, you confirm that a Social Security Number has never been issued to you and you are not presently eligible for a Social Security Number. You understand that pursuant to California Vehicle Code §12801, you must provide your Social Security Number to the Department of Motor Vehicles when one is assigned to you. Read the disclaimer for more information.

medicalConditionsPage.pagePrompt: Have you had any medical conditions in the last three years that affected your ability to drive?

cardHistoryPage.pagePromptLicense: Have you ever had a driver license or state-issued ID card?
cardHistoryPage.pagePromptID: Have you ever had a California driver license or ID card?
cardHistoryPage.explanation: The license or ID card must be issued by a U.S. state or another country.
cardHistoryPage.explanationPrompt: Please tell us about your most recent driver license or ID card, even if it's expired.
cardHistoryPage.numberLabel: Driver license or ID card number
cardHistoryPage.stateOrCountryLabel: Driver license or ID card number

nameHistoryPage.pagePrompt: Have you ever applied for a Driver License or ID card under a different name?
nameHistoryPage.explanationPrompt: Please list all previous legal names.
nameHistoryPage.helpText:
For example, include your maiden name. 

 Separate by commas.

licenseIssuesPage.pagePrompt: Have you ever had your driving privilege cancelled, refused, suspended, or revoked?

veteransPage.pagePrompt: Have you ever served in the United States Military?
veteransPage.explanationStart: As a veteran, you may be eligible for benefits like disability compensation.
veteransPage.licensExplanation: Your Driver License can also display the word "Veteran".
veteransPage.idExplanation: Your ID can also display the word "Veteran".
veteransPage.cardsExplanation: Your cards can also display the word "Veteran".
veteransPage.benefitsPrompt: Would you like to receive benefits information for which you may be eligible?

newDesignation.prompt: Would you like to add the word “Veteran” on your {card type} for a $5 fee?
newDesignation.explanation: Many organizations give discounts to veterans with a valid ID.
newDesignation.messageYes: OK, we will add the $5 to your total fee. You will need to complete the Veteran Status Verification Form from your county’s Veteran Service Office and bring it to a DMV field office.

veteransPage.historicDesignationPrompt: Have you ever had the word "Veteran" on a license or state-issued ID card?

existingDesignation.promptLicense: Is "Veteran" printed on your Driver License?

keepDesignationPrompt.licence: Would you like to keep "Veteran" on your Driver License?
keepDesignationPrompt.id: Would you like to keep "Veteran" on your ID?
keepDesignationPrompt.cards: Would you like to keep "Veteran" on your cards?

organDonor.prompt: Do you wish to be an organ or tissue donor?
organDonor.validationMessage: You must mark Yes to maintain the donor dot on your driver license.
organDonor.messageYes: Answering Yes adds your name to the Donate Life California Organ and Tissue Donor Registry, and a pink “donor” dot will appear on your DL/ID card.
organDonor.messageNo: Answering No will not remove your name from the registry. If you wish to remove your name from the registry, you must contact Donate Life California. DMV can remove the pink dot from your DL/ID card, but cannot remove you from the registry.

monetaryContribution.prompt: Would you like to make a voluntary contribution of $2?
monetaryContribution.messageYes: Thank you for your donation! We will add this $2 to your total fee.

summaryPage.prompt: Please take a minute to review your answers.

values: Housecar, 5th wheel over 15000 pounds, or livestock trailer (Class A)

tenYearHistoryPage.prompt: Have you ever been issued a driver license outside of California in the past ten years?
tenYearHistoryPage.explanation: This could be under the same or a different name, and to operate any type of motor vehicle.

fillOutHistoryVia.prompt: We need you to provide your driver license history for the past 10 years.
fillOutHistoryVia.explanation: How would you like to complete your 10 Year History Form?
fillOutHistoryVia.answerField: Get at a DMV field office

onlineForm.prompt: Please tell us about your previous license.

personalInformationSameQuestion.prompt: Is your personal information on this license the same as what is shown below?

personalInformationIsDifferent.prompt: What is your personal information as it was shown on this driver license?

additionalLicenses.prompt: Have you had additional driver licenses issued outside of California?
additionalLicenses.explanation: This could be under the same or a different name, and to operate any type of motor vehicle.

listOfLicenses.prompt: Below is a list of your licenses.

shared.declineToAnswerInformationRegistration: If you select Decline to answer, you will not be registered to vote.
shared.declineToAnswerInformationPreRegistratio: If you select Decline to answer, you will not be pre-registered to vote.

introductionPage.explanation: Under state law, eligible citizens will be registered to vote unless they choose not to in this section. If you’re already registered to vote, this service helps make sure your information is up to date. If you need to register to vote before your DMV visit, you can register online at RegisterToVote.ca.gov.
introductionPage.timeItWillTake:
This section takes most customers 

 3 minutes

citizenshipPage.pagePrompt: Are you a United States citizen?
citizenshipPage.faqQuestion-whatIfNotCitizen: What if I’m not a citizen?
citizenshipPage.faqAnswer-whatIfNotCitizen: If you are not a U.S. citizen, you are not eligible to register to vote.

eligibilityPage.pagePrompt: Do you meet ALL of the voter registration requirements listed below?
eligibilityPage.usCitizenshipStatement: I am a United States citizen
eligibilityPage.caCitizenshipStatement: I am a resident of California
eligibilityPage.ageStatement: I am at least 18 years old
eligibilityPage.convictionStatement: I am not currently in state or federal prison or on parole for the conviction of a felony
eligibilityPage.mentalCompetenceStatement: I am not currently found mentally incompetent to vote by a court
eligibilityPage.faqQuestion-whatIfDontMeetRequirements: What if I don’t meet all the requirements?
eligibilityPage.faqAnswer-whatIfDontMeetRequirements: If you don’t meet all the requirements, you are not eligible to register to vote.

optOutPage.answer-new-registration: I want to register to vote.
optOutPage.anwser-update-registration: I am registered to vote and want to update my voter registration information.
optOutPage.anwser-opt-out: I do not want to register to vote or update my voter registration information.

preRegIntroductionPage.explanation:
Under state law, eligible citizens will be pre-registered to vote unless they choose not to in this section. 

 If you’re 16 or 17, you can pre-register today. Once you turn 18, you’re automatically registered to vote.

preRegCitizenshipPage.faqAnswer-whatIfNotCitizen: If you are not a U.S. citizen, you are not eligible to pre-register to vote.

preRegEligibilityPage.ageStatement: I am at least 16 or 17 years old
preRegEligibilityPage.faqQuestion-howDoesPreRegWork: How does pre-registering to vote work?
preRegEligibilityPage.faqAnswer-howDoesPreRegWork: To pre-register to vote in California, you must be 16 or 17 years old and meet all of the other eligibility requirements to vote. You will automatically be registered to vote on your 18th birthday.

preRegOptOutPage.answer-new-registration: I want to pre-register to vote.
preRegOptOutPage.anwser-update-registration: I am pre-registered to vote and want to update my voter pre-registration information.
preRegOptOutPage.anwser-opt-out: I do not want to pre-register to vote or update my voter pre-registration information.

preferencesIntoPage.pagePrompt: Next you will choose your voter preferences.
preferencesIntoPage.languageExplanation: Choose a language for your election materials.
preferencesIntoPage.byMailExplanation: Receive your ballot in the mail for all future elections, meaning you don’t have to go to a polling place to vote.
preferencesIntoPage.contactInfoExplanation: Provide your contact information if you want election officials to contact you about election and voter information.

choosePartyPage.pagePrompt: Would you like to choose a political party preference?
choosePartyPage.explanation: If you do not choose a political party, you may not be able to vote for some parties’ candidates at a primary election for US President or central committee.
choosePartyPage.answer-no: I do not wish to choose a political party

chooseLanguagePage.pagePrompt: Choose a language for your election materials.

byMailPage.pagePrompt: Would you like to get your ballot by mail before each election?
byMailPage.explanation: If you answer Yes, you can still vote in-person.

contactInfoPage.pagePrompt: Would you like to receive election information via email or text?

confirmation.pagePrompt: Thank you, your voter registration application will be processed when you complete your business at the DMV.
confirmation.explanation: If you do not receive a voter notification card within four weeks after your visit to the DMV, contact your county elections official. You can check your voter registration status with the California Secretary of State at voterstatus.sos.ca.gov.

preferencesUpdateIntoPage.pagePrompt: Next we’d like to quickly make sure your voter registration is up to date.
preferencesUpdateIntoPage.explanation: This will replace your previous voter preferences.

updateChoosePartyPage.explanation:
If you do not choose a political party, you may not be able to vote for some parties’ candidates at a primary election for US President or central committee. 

 This will overwrite your previous political party preference.

updateContactInfoPage.explanation: Answering No will also remove any previous contact information.
